data.scheme_name: Goa Tribal Employment Generation Programme Scheme (GTEGP) - Manufacturing Industry - NYI
data.benefits: Scheme provides credit-linked subsidy of 40% on loan amount, for project cost up to Rs.25 lakhs.
data.eligibility:
1. Age: 18 to 45 years of age
  2. Unemployed individual;  
  3. Educational qualification: Minimum 4th Standard pass (relaxable in deserving cases) 
  4. Domicile: Permanent resident of Goa for atleast 15 years
data.conditions:
1. The applicable should satisfy following conditions: 
  2. Compulsory entrepreneurship training of up to 7 days within six months from the date of sanction. 
  3. Should not be a defaulter to any bank, financial institution, etc. 
  4. The promoters contribution should be 5% of the total project cost.
data.beneficiaries:
1. Age: Unemployed individual; 18 to 45 years of age 
  2. Educational qualification: Minimum 4th Standard pass (relaxable in deserving cases) 
  3. Domicile: Permanent resident of Goa for atleast 15 years
data.prerequisites:
1. The applicant should satisfy following conditions: 
  2. Compulsory entrepreneurship training of up to 7 days within six months from the date of sanction. 
  3. Should not be a defaulter to any bank, financial institution, etc.
data.context: The Scheme was introduced by the Department of Tribal Welfare, Government of Goa to address the employment needs of educated unemployed individuals belonging to tribal communities in Goa.
data.objective:
1. The aim of the Goa Tribal’s Employment Generation Programme Scheme is to promote self-employment among educated unemployed individuals from tribal communities in Goa. 
  2. By providing financial assistance, training, and support, the scheme aims to empower beneficiaries to establish their own enterprises, generate income, and contribute to economic development.
data.description:
1. Assistance provided under scheme: 
  2. Maximum Project Cost: Rs. 25 Lakhs
  3.  Maximum Working Capital Limit: 35% 
  4. Subsidy Applicable on Loan Amount: 40% 
  5. Promoter’s Contribution: 5%. 
  6. Interest Rate: 2% per annum 
  7. Repayment Schedule: Repayable in 60 to 120 EMIs (As per discretion of GTEGP-TFC). 
  8. Moratorium Period: 3 to 6 months (At the discretion of GTEGP-TFC). 
  9. Security: The first charge of mortgage/hypothecation of fixed assets (building, furniture, machinery, etc.) and/or current assets (trading goods, raw material, etc.)
data.how_to_apply:
The applicant has to apply offline through following procedure: 

  • Step 1: The interested applicant should visit the Department of Tribal Welfare, Govt. of Goa. 
  • Step 2: Take a print of the proforma of the application form, or request a hard copy from the concerned authority. 
  • Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required). 
  • Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned authority.
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefit after the approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
1. Negative List (List of Sectors/Activity not Eligible for Interest Rebate) Alcohol & Liquor of all types. 
  2. Barge Sector Construction of Commercial & Residential Complexes. Transport Sector Sponge Iron, Steel Ingots/ Rolling mills. Tobacco products. Mining Equipment & Machinery. 
  3. All Rescheduled/restructured loans. Loans extended to Government Corporations, CMRY & GTEGP loans, Personal loans, Housing Loans and Vehicle loans any other sector/activity as decided by the Government from time to time. 
  4. New loans including takeover loans (Standard category), are eligible, provided the activity/sector is not included in the negative list. 
  5. Working Capital Term loans would also be eligible under the scheme. 
  6. The rebate eligible will be adjusted towards the principal/interest outstanding/payable by the borrower to EDC, in the subsequent financial year, subject to receipt of the same from the Government or if regular the same reimbursed to the unit. 
  7. The present interest rebate scheme shall not be applicable, if the unit/party is already availing interest subsidy/rebate benefit, under any Central or State Government Schemes. 
  8. In case the unit is found ineligible on account of misrepresentation/miscalculation, the amount of interest rebate released shall be repayable forthwith by the unit/party and shall become recoverable as arrears of Land Revenue.
data.checklist_info_a:
For Loan Assistance:-
(Fill up the prescribed application form and submit the same in duplicate along with self-attested copies of the following documents)
2 recent photographs. (borrower & guarantor).
Birth Certificate. 
Valid Caste Certificate from Competent Authority. 
School leaving or qualification certificate. 
15 years residential certificate.
House tax receipt. (borrower & guarantor).
EPIC/UID. (borrower & guarantor).
Any other relevant certificate. (Marriage/caste/handicap/widow).
Professional Driving license, badge, and business assurance recommendation letter in case of loan for the vehicle. 
Bank pass book/s of existing accounts (borrower & guarantor).
Pan Card (borrower & guarantor).
For Project Report:-
(Fill up the prescribed project report form and submit the same in duplicate along with the following documents)
All quotations of assets to be acquired and also of raw material or stock, from authorized dealers.
Registration of the unit wherever necessary.
N.O.C./Trade License from Panchayat/Municipality.
Any other requisite N.O.C. from a Government department or authority as applicable.
N.O.C. on stamp paper of ₹ 50/- and in prescribed format from the owner of the premises where the activity is proposed to be started.
Latest Tax receipt/registration of the shop, pertaining to the proposed premises.
Electricity/water connection proof (Wherever necessary).
data.beneficiary: Specific Manufacturing Industry - All Entities - Goa - Micro and Small
